info.title: Management API
info.description:
#### Introduction

Welcome to the Management API documentation. You can use this API to manage customer integrations and connections.

#### Base API URL

```
https://api.supaglue.io/mgmt/v2
```

get.description: Get a list of magic links

200.description: List of objects and their field mappings (if set)
List of objects and their field mappings (if set)

get.description: Get a list of Sync Configs

put.description:
:::danger
If `force_delete_syncs` is set to true, any syncs for any deleted objects will be cascadingly deleted for all customers with this sync config.
:::

parameters.name: force_delete_syncs
parameters.description: If true, any syncs for any deleted objects will be cascadingly deleted for all customers with this sync config

delete.description:
:::danger
If `force_delete_syncs` is set to true, all syncs for all customers with this sync config will be cascadingly deleted.
:::

parameters.name: force_delete_syncs
parameters.description: If true, all syncs for all customers with this sync config will be cascadingly deleted

put.description: Use this to override SyncConfig and Destination configurations on a per customer-connection basis. E.g. you can override the objects that are synced per customer-connection as well as override the table/collection that these objects are written into.

post.description: This endpoint is for providers that use API key or access key for authentication. Please use [Embedded Links](https://docs.supaglue.com/platform/managed-auth#oauth-20) for providers that support Oauth2 for authentication.

api_key.description: API key for the connected customer.

access_key.description: Access key for the connected customer.

access_key_secret.description: Access key secret for the connected customer.

get.summary: Get logged in User ID and details
get.description:
This endpoint returns the ID of the logged in (common schema) User and details.

The common schema User ID maps to the following 3rd-party provider object IDs:

| Provider   | Remote object ID  |
| ---------- | ----------------- |
| Salesforce | User              |
| Hubspot    | V3 Owner          |
| Dynamics   | Azure System User |
| Intercom   | Admin             |

user_id.description: The ID of the logged in user that originates from your customer's third-party Provider. Refer to the table above for the Provider ID mapping.

raw_details.description: The raw data from the your customer's third-party Provider.

additional_raw_details.description: For some third-party Providers, there may be additional data used to lookup the common schema User ID (e.g. with Hubspot)

204.description: An empty body is returned on successful deletion.

get.description:
Get rate limit info for a connection. This endpoint is only available for
salesforce and apollo connections.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page

object_type.description: The object type to filter by

object_type.description: The object type to filter by

object.description: The Supaglue object to filter by

entity_id.description: The entity id to filter by

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The customer ID that uniquely identifies the customer in your application

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: The entity id to filter by

parameters.name: start_timestamp
parameters.description: The start time to filter by. Should start with one of [`>`, `<`] followed by an ISO 8601 timestamp.

parameters.name: end_timestamp
parameters.description: The end time to filter by. Should start with [`>`, `<`] followed by an ISO 8601 timestamp.

tags.name: Customers
tags.description: A `Customer` represents one of your customers.

tags.name: Connections
tags.description: A `Connection` represents a Customer's connection to a Provider.

tags.name: ConnectionSyncConfigs
tags.description: A `ConnectionSyncConfig` is a configuration for how to sync a specific Customer's data from a Provider to a Destination on a schedule.

tags.name: Destinations
tags.description: A `Destination` is a data store where we write data in your infrastructure.

tags.name: Magic Links
tags.description: A `Magic Link` is a secure URL that allows your customers to connect their accounts to Supaglue.

tags.name: Providers
tags.description: A `Provider` is a third-party SaaS tool we can connect to (e.g. Salesforce).

tags.name: Schemas
tags.description: A [`Schema`](https://docs.supaglue.com/platform/objects/overview#schemas) allows you to normalize fields for customers across a single Provider object. Supaglue uses Schemas for Managed Syncs and Actions API.

tags.name: Entities
tags.description: An [`Entity`](https://docs.supaglue.com/platform/entities/overview) allows you to represent your application data models in Supaglue so customers can map their different Provider objects and fields. Supaglue uses Entities for Managed Syncs and Actions API.

tags.name: EntityMappings
tags.description: An [`Entity Mapping`](https://docs.supaglue.com/platform/entities/overview#entity-mapping) maps an [Entity](https://docs.supaglue.com/platform/entities/overview) to a customer's Provider object and fields. Use Entity Mappings when you use [Entities](https://docs.supaglue.com/platform/entities/overview) as your data model.

tags.name: SchemaMappings
tags.description: A `Schema Mapping` is a mapping between a [Schema](https://docs.supaglue.com/platform/objects/overview#schemas) field and fields in your customer's Provider object.

tags.name: SyncConfigs
tags.description: A `SyncConfig` is a configuration for how to sync your Customers' data from a Provider to a Destination on a schedule.

tags.name: SyncRuns
tags.description: A `SyncRun` is a single execution of a Sync at a point in time.

tags.name: Syncs
tags.description: A `Sync` is a way for a Customer to sync data from a Provider to a Destination on a schedule.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: A `Webhook` is a way for Supaglue to notify you when events have happened.

x-api-key.name: x-api-key
x-api-key.description: API key to allow developers to access the API

entity_mappings.description: This is for object/field mappings when you data model using [Entities](https://docs.supaglue.com/platform/entities/overview). The object/field mappings (aka [Entity Mappings](https://docs.supaglue.com/platform/entities/overview#entity-mapping)) here are set by you, the developer, and the mappings apply for all your customers.

version.description: A monotonically increasing version number of the destination configuration

oneOf.title: supaglue
oneOf.description: A Supaglue-hosted Postgres database destination for Listing APIs.

version.description: A monotonically increasing version number of the destination configuration
A monotonically increasing version number of the destination configuration
A monotonically increasing version number of the destination configuration
A monotonically increasing version number of the destination configuration
A monotonically increasing version number of the destination configuration

mapped_name.description: The field your customer maps. This is a Provider-specified field name. E.g. FirstName for Salesforce.

allow_additional_field_mappings.description: Specifies whether your customer can add new application field names.

return_url.description: URL to redirect to after the connection is authorized.

expires_at.description: Any ISO formatted date-time string indicating when the magic link expires.

return_url.description: URL to redirect to after the connection is authorized.

objects.description: This is for field mappings when you data model using [Objects](https://docs.supaglue.com/platform/objects/overview). The field mappings (aka [Schemas](https://docs.supaglue.com/platform/objects/overview#schemas)) here are set by you, the developer, and the mappings apply for all your customers.

schema_id.description: If set, will sync these mapped fields into the raw_data column in addition to the common object. If not set, will fetch all fields as is.

name.description: The name of the field as set in the schema

is_added_by_customer.description: Whether the field was added by the customer (only applicable if the schema has allow_additional_field_mappings set to true)

schema_mapped_name.description: The mapped named of the field as set in the schema by the developer. If set, the customer cannot override. Only one of `schema_mapped_name` or `customer_mapped_name` should be set.

customer_mapped_name.description: The mapped name of the field as set by the customer. Only one of `schema_mapped_name` or `customer_mapped_name` should be set.

instance_url.description: Instance URL for the connected customer.

schema_mappings_config.description: This is for field mappings when you data model using [Objects](https://docs.supaglue.com/platform/objects/overview#schemas). The field mappings here are set by your customers using the [Field Mappings API](https://docs.supaglue.com/api/v2/mgmt/update-object-field-mappings).

entity_mappings.description: This is for object/field mappings when you data model using [Entities](https://docs.supaglue.com/platform/entities/overview#entity-mapping). The object/field mappings here are set by your customers using the [Entity Mappings API](https://docs.supaglue.com/api/v2/mgmt/upsert-entity-mapping).

reset_time.description: The time (in epoch seconds) at which the rate limit will reset. If missing, the rate limit is a sliding window.

common_objects.description: A list of Supaglue objects to be synced.

associations_to_fetch.description:
A list of associated objects to fetch when syncing this object. 
If empty or unspecified, no additional associations will be fetched other than the ones required to populate the common model.
Only relevant for Hubspot.

items.description: Name of the associated object to fetch

standard_objects.description: A list of case-sensitive Provider objects to be synced.

associations_to_fetch.description:
A list of associated objects to fetch when syncing this object. 
If empty or unspecified, no associations will be fetched.
Only relevant for Hubspot.

items.description: Name of the associated object to fetch

custom_objects.description: A list of case-sensitive custom objects to be synced. Only supported for Salesforce and Hubspot.

object.description: The custom object name (case sensitive). For Salesforce, this should end with `__c`.

associations_to_fetch.description:
A list of associated objects to fetch when syncing this object. 
If empty or unspecified, no associations will be fetched.
Only relevant for Hubspot.

items.description: Name of the associated object to fetch

period_ms.description: The period (in milliseconds) to run the sync.

strategy.description: \"full then incremental\" will run a full sync on the first run, then incremental syncs. \"full only\" will run a full sync on every run.

auto_start_on_connection.description:
If true, the sync will start automatically when the connection is created.
Default: true

full_sync_every_n_incrementals.description: If set, Supaglue will run a full sync after N consecutive incremental syncs.

create_provider_config.description: An object that stores Oauth2/API key/access key related credentials.

use_managed_oauth.description: True: use Supaglue's OAuth application credentials. False: Use the provided OAuth application credentials.

update_provider_config.description: An object that stores Oauth2/API key/access key related credentials.

oneOf.title: supaglue
oneOf.description: A Supaglue-hosted Postgres database destination for Listing APIs.

destination_config.description: An object to override the default Destination configuration per connection.

schema.description: The schema you'd like to sync to. This schema must already exist. Supaglue will not create it. If not specified, the schema specified in the Postgres Destination will be used.

standard_objects.description: A list of case-sensitive Provider standard objects to by synced. If specified, this list will take override the custom_objects list in SyncConfig.

table.description: The table to write the object to. If specified, this will override the default table used by Supaglue.

custom_objects.description: (Preview) A list of case-sensitive Provider custom objects to be synced. If specified, this list will take override the custom_objects list in SyncConfig.

table.description: The table to write the object to. If specified, this will override the default table used by Supaglue.

entity_field.description: The name of the field in your application.

mapped_field.description: The name of the field in your customer's third-party Provider tool (e.g. Salesforce).

destination_config.description: An object to override the default Destination configuration per connection.

schema.description: The schema you'd like to sync to. This schema must already exist. Supaglue will not create it. If not specified, the schema specified in the Postgres Destination will be used.

dataset.description: The dataset you'd like to sync to. This dataset must already exist. Supaglue will not create it. If not specified, the dataset specified in the BigQuery Destination will be used.

standard_objects.description: A list of case-sensitive Provider standard objects to by synced. If specified, this list will take override the custom_objects list in SyncConfig.

table.description: The table to write the object to. If specified, this will override the default table used by Supaglue.

custom_objects.description: (Preview) A list of case-sensitive Provider custom objects to be synced. If specified, this list will take override the custom_objects list in SyncConfig.

table.description: The table to write the object to. If specified, this will override the default table used by Supaglue.

id.description: A unique identifier for the instance of the error. Provide this to support when contacting Supaglue.

detail.description: A detailed description of the error.
detail.example: Property values were not valid: [{"isValid":false,"message":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist","error":"PROPERTY_DOESNT_EXIST","name":"__about_us","localizedErrorMessage":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist"}]

problem_type.description: The Supaglue error code associated with the error.

title.description: A brief description of the error. The schema and type of message will vary by Provider.

code.description: The Supaglue error code associated with the error.

status.description: The HTTP status code associated with the error.

cause.description: The cause of the error. Usually the underlying error from the remote Provider.

body.message: Property values were not valid: [{"isValid":false,"message":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist","error":"PROPERTY_DOESNT_EXIST","name":"__about_us","localizedErrorMessage":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist"}]

application_name.description: The name of the application that generated the error.

body.message: Property values were not valid: [{"isValid":false,"message":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist","error":"PROPERTY_DOESNT_EXIST","name":"__about_us","localizedErrorMessage":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist"}]

example.detail: Property values were not valid: [{"isValid":false,"message":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist","error":"PROPERTY_DOESNT_EXIST","name":"__about_us","localizedErrorMessage":"Property \"__about_us\" does not exist"}]
example.title: Property values were not valid
